bow: do know how to be stay at home mom of toddler without totally losing my shit every other hour ve been stay at home for just months my daughter is years old the mornings usually start out okay but somewhere towards the middle of the day just do have any patience to offer choices to beg and plead over diaper changes for getting hit and kicked by tiny little hands ve read articles about all the tricks for tantrums but what about getting through all the tiny awful shit all the little things like taking your shoes off every time we get in the car or refusing to get in your carseat for 15 minutes any time we need to go somewhere or kicking me in the face halfway through poopy diaper change this defiance stage just feels like every mandatory interaction with my daughter is raking my brain across cheese grater sorry if this is the wrong place for this but who do you talk to about this stuff all my parent friends act like toddlerdom was never this bad am just not cut out for stay at home parenting at this point having more tantrums than she is wish had advice to give sahm to almost year old boy some days are bad some are better ve been getting super frustrated with him lately which sure he can sense and his behavior gets worse thought was gon na lose my damn mind yesterday good luck to you not there yet as my little one is much younger but have to say this being stay at home mom is hard though had very demanding and fast paced career that thought was eating my soul it was still much easier than raising tiny human the ability to live in world where you get to communicate with adults daily go to the bathroom when you want and to sometimes just sit in silence and do whatever it is you need to do yeah that golden now love my little girl with every fiber of my being and staying home is clearly beneficial to her so it what we re doing right now it does change the fact that it hard and when my mr comes home sometimes need baby break wish had advice to offer but mainly just posting to commiserate my son will be in august and it as though every interaction we have is fight he kicks screams hits just flips his little blond head over everything honestly can not wait for him to outgrow this stage miss my sweet little smiling cooing baby just try to have as much patience with him as can because they all go through it it just really hard sometimes and have to force myself to smile at him through gritted teeth it not you do beat yourself up she learning defiance and pushing boundaries and disobedience which are all *good things* but huge pain in the ass when what you need is cooperation may not be qualified to answer this because am not stay at home mom and my lo is only 17 months old but how is your structure activity level for your daughter find that when my lo and are busy things go smoother when we are just winging it since back when was on maternity leave if we did get out of the house for at least bit by 3pm it became crazy time and then she feeds off my stress and gets even crazier and we enter an infinite loop of mommy amp baby crankiness tantrums also do you have any policies in place have watched ton of nanny shows and read blogs and watched other parents and at 17 months am already working on time outs the other night my lo bit me intentionally and then when firmly told her no we do bite and hurt people she pinched me so finished her diaper change and put her into her crib for time out for minute yr old figured min seems like eternity she screamed but there was no more biting or pinching that night similar thing the next night so same process the big thing is to have policies communicate them and be consistent and you are definitely not alone we are just society that wants to shout from the rooftops if our kid makes the honor roll but god forbid we even whisper that little tommy threw tantrum at the toy store my mother days vodka in the tea helps say make lots of friends and have play dates or drink wine am sahm of four year old boy drink lot of wine and go on lots of play dates and hang out at parks if he happy so am not stay at home mom but typically have the kids with just me on the weekends when my daughter was that age there were plenty of weekends that looked forward to monday toddlerhood is *hard* it does get better my daughter is and she mostly stopped the tantrums and such now though she still has her days the only advice have to give is be firm and be consistent pick the things that are really important and work on getting those behaviors where you want them then pick something else to work on it takes time and patience but you will get there if needed break would turn on my daughter favorite movie to get bit of peace good luck please do feel obligated to stay home if it really is working and you can go back to work did not enjoy being sahm luckily was taking college classes for two nights week for three years and cherished every last moment was in the classroom felt really guilty the entire time and was thrilled when went back to work deleted as previous comments have said staying at home with toddler is hard especially at when they still ca quite communicate effectively my go to techniques are pick your battles distraction and stay laughing for example does it really matter if shoes are on in the car maybe this is battle that does need to be fought tell your child they can leave shoes off till you are at the destination but they must have them on when out of the car save your combat energy for important things like not touching the hot stove or not kicking you in the face second distraction my son loves toy cars so every single time we change diaper hand him car to hold and play with till we re done usually this distracts him long enough for me to ninja him out of and into diaper also by distraction mean activities busy toddler is happy toddler which is in turn happy parent this can be anything along the lines of playgroups play dates park or outdoor time painting exploring playing with toys watching fun show etc toddlers are easy to distract and the more busy they are the less likely they are to drive you insane and lastly have fun if my son is driving me up the wall the very best thing for it is to go into the bedroom and let him jump on our bed sit with him while he jumps and we have tickle fights and blow on his belly and get kisses and hugs and it ends in fits of giggles what easier to make you both feel better than laughing together haha more wine noted oh can empathize my son just turned and expecting my second any day now am sahm and have had quite few days lately where things are harder and harder to answer your question about getting through all the tiny little problems through the day try to remain calm and think of ways that are compassionate yet still assert the boundaries want to set as mom for example give lots of option choices even though both options are ones can live with you have choice you can get in the car or can put you in the car and then follow through with regard to the kicks at diaper changing can definitely empathize my favorite is if it before nap or bed time your behavior is showing me you are too tired for story so you can either calm your body and stop kicking or we are going straight to bed without book and then follow through using the choices and the your behavior is telling me line helps him but being consistent is key when all else fails put him in safe place and walk away after explaining that we both need break also getting out everyday to get out energy is essential park walk run around block etc definitley helps us and lastly make sure you get some time for yourself do know how hands on your partner is but it amazing what trip to target or starbucks alone at the end of the day can do find alone time essential to my well being do beat yourself up toddlers are nuts sometimes sure you re doing your best but it always nice to reach out for support like this know do the same thing when ve had it good luck whaaa nursing ca do this we ve just started this with our year old and though it taking while the first few times offer options his answer is usually no it definitely starting to gain traction he even more cooperative with things for him if give him some trivial choices for me what shirt should mommy wear should drink tea or milk at what age did you start with your son and how long until it was pretty routine for him not quite there yet either but yes the days get very long is she still taking naps try to take full advantage of nap time other ways to break up the day snacks parks coloring in the high chair tape parchment paper to the whole top of the tray bath time mine likes baths so it good go to when he ca be pleased bathroom time he takes all my lotion hairspray etc out of baskets just have to make sure the containers stay closed we also do quiet time around 4pm put him in his crib with toys for half hour or so used kids books toys are great cheap way to get 10 20 minutes of quiet while the kid checks them out and yes ve on occasion had beer in the afternoon putting your needs after someone else every day is so hard but she halfway from newborn to kindergarten so there is hope you are not alone thanks so much for your reply have just been so frustrated and wrapped up in the small irritations that forget to have fun and laugh and to focus on that that advice is helpful afternoons with my year old make me happy that work full time angel all morning monster demon all afternoon and he stopped napping just try to wear him out pool jump house playground anything to keep him moving it is hard also month pregnant so am constantly exhausted anyway and thank god for daddy you are saint and offer my best hopes for you in getting through this period hear that at they turn back into real people thanks the advice about explaining what their behavior is telling you could be useful always just assume she does understand language like that ll try it you certainly can drink while nursing as long as you are sober enough to drive http kellymom com bf can breastfeed lifestyle alcohol you are sober enough to nurse cheers it all sounds pretty normal to me the plan was always for me to stay home with our kids it way harder than ever expected have yo as well she likes to kick too ve started to over react to kicks and hits like they re really hurting me and then make her say sorry mom if she keeps kicking then the discipline comes in if you kick again your dinosaurs go bye bye tend to do time outs for behaviors that she knows better but is testing me with for example she knows not to pull the cat tail if she does it once she gets warning no tail or you go to your room when she does it again she gets min in her room set the timer on my phone and set it outside her room really loud so she knows when it over we have doorknob cover on the inside of her door so she ca get out for diaper changes ll either do toy or we ll sing song with motions happy and you know it row your boat and wheels on the bus are popular head and shoulders works with non poopy diapers there are days just want to strangle her that when we have an early bath so she can play to her hearts content while relax on my ipad while watch her also use nap time for me time spend maybe 20 min doing chores and then the rest is recharging time for me willing to let the dishes be dirty in the sink so do start screaming yes you can http www amazon com gp aw b000uea96g ref=redir mdp mobile nursing too and pregnant have the patience of rabid marmot and 20 month old that is going through biting and slapping revival ve resorted to sniffing the whiskey off my husband breath for the semblance of contact high oh yes that me sahm of three kids 11 and lose my sanity quite frequently actually the only balance have found which just began this past year is having alone time with no kids for an hour per day sometimes go to the gym sometimes veg out in front of the tv or computer other times go out to friends house or go get massage or mani pedi the biggest thing ve found to help is getting away for just enough time to hit the reset button as end up missing the kids if away too long when get back refreshed and find my patience is greatly increased and my sensitivity greatly decreased good luck here if you like to chat ca really remember when we started this but believe it was somewhere around another really good strategy that works well with this age is letting them know you understand their feelings ll give you an example that literally just happened minutes ago he told me wanted to watch certain movie said no and he got upset responded by saying know you re mad because you want to watch it now but it almost nap time so we ll watch it later he now fine obviously at he just turned this week he can understand more complex language like this at it was more like you re mad mad that you ca do we ll do it later or something like that can honestly say that this type of acknowledgement helps lot at the tender age of is it perfect no does it prevent every temper tantrum no but it makes things lot better and makes him feel like actually care about his feelings which obviously do everything takes good few days to week feel but consistency is key and eventually they figure it out know what you mean about not thinking they ll understand if it seems it over her head make very short simple sentences from my experience she ll get those with some repetition good luck haha feel your pain often smell my husband beer or bourbon gosh ca wait for glass of wine sure lot it is just your daughters age that said why did you choose to be sahp is it possible you are getting extremely frustrated with your daughter because you do really prefer to be sahp for me personally know am not cut out to be sahp my husband is the sahp in our family also there is sub sahp they might have some helpful insight too thanks was needing to change jobs and was considering staying at home for little while just to see how it suited me we had been able to only use daycare for few hours day working opposite schedules but as soon as left my job my daughters schedule changed and now we would need full daycare before could go back to work so right now we re trying to decide if can stay home whether can handle it mentally and if we can handle it financially thanks do get whole lot of alone time throughout the day would love to see if some alone time completely away from her in the middle of the day would help with my patience constantly questioning whether have the patience to be parent thanks for the advice have tried singing the motion songs while doing diaper changes that could work this is really encouraging we ve also been trying to get him telling us when he upset in place of hitting hoping this works since little worried about the hitting when his little sister arrives ok can see myself getting soooooo turned on if did this gt ve read articles about all the tricks for tantrums but what about getting through all the tiny awful shit all the little things like taking your shoes off every time we get in the car or refusing to get in your carseat for 15 minutes any time we need to go somewhere or kicking me in the face halfway through poopy diaper change choose your battles if she takes her shoes off in the car start just putting her in the car without shoes hold her shoes up in the front with you then put her shoes on when you get to your destination do not beg plead or argue with toddler physically place your daughter in her car seat going to estimate that you have at least 100 lbs on her when you change her diaper restrain her legs so she can not kick you toddlers are irrational creatures driven by their desires 90 of the time you have to physically parent them by that mean you have to physically move them away from the outlet you have to physically restrain them you have to physically put them where you want them otherwise you are basically just talking to brick wall if you want them to do something that conflicts with their desires teacher and home for the summer with my six month old and year old it crazy frustrating sometimes but find having schedule helps we go somewhere every morning if the library not having story time and we do have play date go to the gym and they go to the childcare in the gym home by 11 lunch independent play in her room if you come out will put you in your crib she eventually is ready for nap comes out to tell me she is ready then nap after nap we do some kind of activity bubbles colored ice cube play sprinkler colored cold spaghetti something then dad home yay we survived another day forget often as well sometimes they re just so frustrating lol toddlers are hard my twins are only 15 months so take what say with that in mind ve been staying at home with them since they were born this is part of the adjustment and go through the same adjustment when they have big changes nap schedule changes developmental spurts etc patience my friend slog through and try to make it easier on both of you in any way you can if you just recently started staying at home and she had been with another caregiver or in daycare she is adjusting too it will get better it is gradual process and one day you will realize that things are much easier and that you are used to being sahm also people who say toddlerdom was hard do remember it man have so much empathy for you also sahm to yr old love him like crazy but get so mad lately just want to throttle him it the defiance as you said and the tantrums are just getting crazy he never used to cry much so now that he is crying ton loudly and is really distractible am going craaazy this is going to probably sound flaky but friend just reminded me to work on mindfulness like ok there that feeling again ll just feel it it uncomfortable is it weird how tight my chest gets also deep breathing or picturing yourself letting go of your anger like leaf floating down the river or something it all sounds pretty silly but swear it works if you can remember to do it and it gets easier with practice last suggestion xpost to breakingmom or consider subscribing over there good luck and hang in there mama seriously only weeks in and though love my little man so much really start to watch the clock waiting for my husband to get home from work when he has to work late get upset at the situation not at him think it the constancy of it you literally never get break even if they go down for nap you never know when you might need to be 100 involved with them again they could sleep for hours or minutes and you need to be ready for that gt they could sleep for hours or minutes and you need to be ready for that that is the truth months in and some days are easy breezy and full of sweet baby smiles but days like today where she gassy and fussy and tries to claw my face while biting my nipple and kick me in the stomach well let just say it special kind of day and mama really wants to order sushi delivery tonight head on over to breakingmom also gritting my teeth as we speak with mason jar of moscato listening to my two year old scream and scream she has clean diaper full bottle full tummy and whole day of playtime god help us the ymca in our area has childcare included in the membership for 2hrs day they also have cafe and library never worked out there before but my kids get daypasses and get break when it gets bad then we all go for swim and head home for naptime it takes time to adjust and you ve started at rough age make friends with other sahps and get out of the house together often kids playing together give you break and another adult to talk to is good for those days when you wish you could pour spiked coffee directly into your blood steam try to plan ahead extra clothes snacks toy and little bag of bribery gummies for mommy emergencies then get out as much as possible would be lying if did go through these exact same things as well it takes an ungodly amount of patience but it sounds like you re doing well have been stay at home mom for almost 10 years with part time jobs on and off for sanity and have days where have meltdown like my year old lost more than few years to serious depression and am only recently coming out of the fog it took me years to admit staying at home with my kids was the reason was depressed had such guilt because supposed to love this right meh have found that if have something to work on project or goal and take time for myself to work on those am much happier you know when you hear mom say take time for yourself and you roll your eyes like yeah right who has time for me it helps have to make time if go more than few days without some separation that when my anxiety meltdowns happen that reminds me to make time or else dragon lady shows up and toddlers are hard they just are my year can be such terror have days question having children you are doing good mama one thing that worked for me was deciding what were non negotiable sand what as others mentioned is not fight worthy non negotiable were arbitrary and all care givers must know what they are so the same rule is always enforced holding hand when crossing the street non neg holding hands while walking down the block ok but stay steps from the road at dinner she had to have bites of everything beyond that up to her hitting me absolutely never and when non negs were broken she got punished the first couple times get warnings after that it nuclear option to bed until the end of the next sleep cycle so if it almost nap time everything stops go to bed stay there until normal nap is over for all other things tried to eliminate out the negotiations as much as possible or rather control the options we are going now you have to wear hoody do you want the red or green one do ask what do you want they ca figure it out and will drag it out because their brains ca wrap around all the choices controlling the options limits the possibilities but gives them the sense that they are in control the great thing here is that you know your kid and what they ll want but you know what you want them to choose so on issues where you really want them to do this thing your way you give them an option you know they wo like as much as the option you want them to take and they choose what you wanted them to do never use just because as reason either tell her the truth and am straight forward do sugar coat or dumb down might not go into super detailed reasons scale that to her age but at the same time do shy away from big words using adult terms makes her able to function around adults example she could use the word conversation correctly in sentence at also told her would always consider her ideas and opinions but never if they were screamed at me value her thoughts and wants but she has to speak them to me not scream or throw fit good luck it does get better am so in your shoes and reading all the responses helped me feel not so lost and alone saw some post on facebook think that had ideas for entertaining toddler on the cheap maybe if you google that the ideas will come am trying out the one that sounded most promising taping cardboard tube to the wall or in my case three different sizes to piece of cardboard and letting your kid drop pompoms through them cost playing chase lot helps wear me mean him out safaris are fun and we ride the lawnmower lot diaper changes for us have been improved by letting my little dude decide where he wants to be changed he prefers his bed to the changing station and sometimes the floor the fine art of distraction wore off its efficacy rather quickly but practicing body parts helps having him lift his feet and lift his butt to help with changes has made him feel more in control too lift your arm *tickles* we are in the beginning stages of potty training so that has to be considered and when all else fails and near the end of my rope fucking cookies know its awful but my child has healthy eating habits overall so do what have to do ie pick your battles oh hitting yeah that rough because it obviously behavior that we do want happening especially around baby when my boy acts out in less than calm ways still acknowledge his feelings you must be so angry to be but that not ok let take break and calm down then separate us from one another certainly do want to be pushover and let it happen but still want him to know it absolutely unacceptable while still letting him know get why he did it this type of intervention usually works toddlers are so fun sometimes am sure ll be ready to pull my hair out in couple weeks once the sleep deprivation is paired with caring for newborn and jealous kid someone else gave me some advice that found useful of course we want to promote positive relationship between siblings but it okay to acknowledge that it kinda sucks from the perspective of the older child at times for example if notice that my year old is getting upset while feed the baby might say know it hard when mommy has to feed sister so much instead of playing how about when daddy gets home you and me have some special time together and then do something one on one with the older child walk trip to the park an ice cream date etc from others experiences this seems to help with the jealousy oh dear freaking out now good luck to us all thanks this is all really great info you re welcome hope it helps you might be surprised how much she can understand the key is repetition have thing with my daughter where any time she is upset or tantruming ask her if can talk to her for minute sometimes will ask can tell you something sometimes she says no at first and calmly let her know that will be right there to talk to her when she is ready when she is calm enough to talk will ask her or tell her about whatever just happened mama had to pick you up because you said no to walking up the stairs or did you feel angry because it was time to leave the playground then try to explain why and offer some resolution know it sad sometimes to leave the playground but right now it dinner time we can come back tomorrow to play some more does it always work no but it way more effective than when lose my temper and think it truly is helping her understand consequences of her actions and being able to talk about her feelings sorry for the wall of text exactly sometimes lay contented sleeping baby down at night and smile and other times we re both crying ourselves to sleep lol building on the language thing does she have words for emotions tell my daughter nearly three about emotions all the time and have done since she was baby we play face games where ask her to show me an angry sad happy whatever face find when she getting defiant it often because she angry if stop and as her how she feeling and deal with whatever bugging her she turns into new child good advice do this occasionally but am going to try to do it more often thanks for the reminder definitely like the you do it or do it method you get in the car or ll put you in the car you stop throwing the ball at the tv or ll take away the ball so you can not throw it at the tv and you can have it back tomorrow in some instances it is about control getting dressed getting in the car brushing teeth toddlers love control and then other times it is about discipline throwing ball turning off the tv etc if you do do it will but it comes with price regardless of who does it it gets done and you are begging or arguing with ~~terrorist~~ toddler to get things done deleted haha thanks think something wonder about when other mom say take time for yourself is does the hours after they go to bed before go to bed count that what did when only had one child and it seemed enough at the time when had my second child it became really clear that it was enough for me anymore did live around family and my husband worked all the time so it was always just me and the kids it so draining it gets easier as they get older it just feels like fucking eternity here the good bad news you going completely crazy is absolutely normal few people handle it better than you are handling it now for the seat does she get in the seat by herself yet find that having surprise present usually toy that display in my hand and say if you can get in the seat by the time count to five four and quarter four and half four and three quarters… you can play with this toy some toddlers really like the feeling of agency if you can try to make it seem like many of the things she has to do are things that she gets to do and has control over assuming you do not actually live in china shop if the kid drives you crazy especially if you notice yourself getting angry give yourself time out let your kid know this is happening mommy is getting angry so she gets time out will be out very soon then go somewhere close by with door and close it bathrooms are great for this the kid may bang on the door or yell this is okay just take some deep breaths and try your best to get centered
